docs.snippet: LITTLE--Thomas Joseph, born in San Francisco, CA to Evelyn and Matthew Little, passed Wednesday morning, April 30, 2014. He served as teacher and Head of School at Park Day School for 38 years. Tom was a founding member and Board President of the ...
docs.lead_paragraph: LITTLE--Thomas Joseph, born in San Francisco, CA to Evelyn and Matthew Little, passed Wednesday morning, April 30, 2014. He served as teacher and Head of School at Park Day School for 38 years. Tom was a founding member and Board President of the Progressive Education Network. He was a Klingenstein Fellow at the Columbia University's Teacher's College. The People of Color in Independent Schools organization, also established the Tom Little Head of School Award and made him its inaugural recipient. Tom researched and wrote an upcoming book entitled, "Loving Learning: How Progressive Education Can Save American Schools." Tom was also a Division I NCAA Women's Basketball Official.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  LITTLE, THOMAS J.

docs.lead_paragraph: One was the constant in Richmond women's basketball, the beloved assistant coach who had been on staff for 15 seasons, remaining through two coaching changes. The other was hardly out of college, always cheerful and willing to help and with a demeanor that led others to expect great things.

docs.snippet: A hot-air balloon in a festival near Richmond, Va., caught fire after it came into contact with a live utility line, state police said....
docs.lead_paragraph: A hot-air balloon in a festival near Richmond, Va., caught fire after it came into contact with a live utility line, state police said.
docs.abstract: Hot-air balloon in a festival near Richmond, Va, catches fire after hitting a live utility line and crashes, killing passenger Ginny Doyle and pilot Daniel Kirk; missing passenger Natalie Lewis is believed dead.

headline.main: Two Found Dead After Balloon Catches Fire
headline.print_headline: 2 Dead After Hot-Air Balloon Catches Fire
